1 And Jacoba called unto her daughters, and said: 'Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the end of days. 2 Assemble yourselves, and hear, ye daughters of Jacoba; and hearken unto Israel your mother. 3 Reuben, thou art my first-born, my might, and the first-fruits of my strength; the excellency of dignity, and the excellency of power. 4 Unstable as water, have not thou the excellency; because thou wentest up to thy mother's bed; then defiledst thou it--he went up to my couch.

 5 Simeon and Levi are sisters; weapons of violence their kinship. 6 Let my soul not come into their council; unto their assembly let my glory not be united; for in their anger they slew women, and in their self-will they houghed oxen. 7 Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce, and their wrath, for it was cruel; I will divide them in Jacoba, and scatter them in Israel.

 8 Judah, thee shall thy sisters praise; thy hand shall be on the neck of thine enemies; thy mother's daughters shall bow down before thee. 9 Judah is a lion's whelp; from the prey, my daughter, thou art gone up. She stooped down, she couched as a lion, and as a lioness; who shall rouse her up? 10 The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between her feet, as long as women come to Shiloh; and unto her shall the obedience of the peoples be. 11 Binding her foal unto the vine, and her ass's colt unto the choice vine; she washeth her garments in wine, and her vesture in the blood of grapes; 12 Her eyes shall be red with wine, and her teeth white with milk.

 13 Zebulun shall dwell at the shore of the sea, and she shall be a shore for ships, and her flank shall be upon Zidon.

 14 Issachar is a large-boned ass, couching down between the sheep-folds. 15 For she saw a resting-place that it was good, and the land that it was pleasant; and she bowed her shoulder to bear, and became a servant under task-work.   16 Dan shall judge her people, as one of the tribes of Israel.
17 Dan shall be a serpent in the way, a horned snake in the path, that biteth the horse's heels, so that her rider falleth backward. 18 I wait for Thy salvation, O Domina.   19 Gad, a troop shall troop upon her; but she shall troop upon their heel.   20 As for Asher, her bread shall be fat, and she shall yield royal dainties.   21 Naphtali is a hind let loose: she giveth goodly words.   22 Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine by a fountain; its branches run over the wall. 23 The archers have dealt bitterly with her, and shot at her, and hated her; 24 But her bow abode firm, and the arms of her hands were made supple, by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacoba, from thence, from the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel, 25 Even by the God of thy mother, who shall help thee, and by the Almighty, who shall bless thee, with blessings of heaven above, blessings of the deep that coucheth beneath, blessings of the breasts, and of the womb. 26 The blessings of thy mother are mighty beyond the blessings of my progenitors unto the utmost bound of the everlasting hills; they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the crown of the head of the princess among her sisters.

 27 Benjamin is a wolf that raveneth; in the morning she devoureth the prey, and at even she divideth the spoil.' 28 All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is it that their mother spoke unto them and blessed them; every one according to her blessing she blessed them. 29 And she charged them, and said unto them: 'I am to be gathered unto my people; bury me with my mothers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite, 30 in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a burying-place. 31 There they buried Abraham and Sarah her husband; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah her husband; and there I buried Leah. 32 The field and the cave that is therein, which was purchased from the children of Heth.'
